vehicles.name: War Rig
vehicles.desc: An eighteen-wheeler armoured with scrap metal, barbed wire, and the welded-on hulls of dead vehicles. She carries fuel, water, and ammunition — the three currencies of the wasteland — and her crew defends her with the desperation of people who know that losing the rig means dying of thirst.
vehicles.notes: The war rig is your convoy centrepiece. Everything revolves around her — she carries what the community needs to survive, and every raider in the wasteland wants what she's carrying. Build chase scenarios where the war rig is the objective both sides fight over.

vehicles.name: Interceptor
vehicles.desc: A muscle car stripped to the bone and supercharged until the engine screams. She's the fastest thing on the broken roads, armed with whatever the driver could bolt to the chassis, and driven by someone with nothing left to lose.
vehicles.notes: The interceptor is your player vehicle. She's fast, she's fragile, and she's personal — every interceptor is unique, customised from scavenged parts. The driver and the car are inseparable. Losing the interceptor is losing a character.

vehicles.name: Buzz Buggy
vehicles.desc: A stripped-down dune buggy with an exposed engine, roll cage, and the ability to cross terrain that would break an axle on anything heavier. She carries two — driver and gunner — and she's fast enough to harass vehicles ten times her size.
vehicles.notes: The buzz buggy is your harassment vehicle. She swarms around larger vehicles, firing and dodging. Use them in packs of three to five, circling the convoy like wolves around a herd. Individually fragile, collectively lethal.

vehicles.name: Thunder Bus
vehicles.desc: A school bus or transit bus armoured with sheet metal and filled with raiders. She's the troop transport of the wasteland — she carries twenty fighters to the ambush site and her roof-mounted weapons provide covering fire while they dismount.
vehicles.notes: The thunder bus delivers enemies. She arrives, the doors open, and twenty screaming raiders pour out. Use her for ambush scenarios where the players face the bus and its cargo simultaneously. She's also the players' community transport — ugly but essential.

vehicles.name: Fuel Tanker
vehicles.desc: The most valuable vehicle in the wasteland. She carries thousands of litres of refined fuel — the lifeblood of every engine, every generator, every community that hasn't gone back to horses. Everyone wants her. Everyone will kill for her.
vehicles.notes: The fuel tanker is your ultimate McGuffin on wheels. She's the prize that drives the campaign — whoever controls the fuel controls the wasteland. She's also a bomb. One well-placed incendiary round and she becomes a fireball that kills everything within a hundred metres.

vehicles.name: Scrap Crawler
vehicles.desc: A tracked vehicle cobbled together from construction equipment, tank parts, and whatever the mechanics could weld into a hull. She's slow, she's ugly, and she carries armour thick enough to stop the improvised weapons that most wasteland vehicles mount.
vehicles.notes: The scrap crawler is your wasteland tank. She's unkillable by small arms and most improvised weapons. The players need heavy weapons, fire, or creative solutions to deal with her. Use her as the warlord's personal vehicle — the thing that makes his warband unstoppable.

vehicles.name: Death Bike
vehicles.desc: A motorcycle with welded-on spikes, a sidecar gun mount, and a rider who's traded safety equipment for intimidation value. She's fast, she's terrifying, and her rider fights with the cheerful nihilism of someone who doesn't expect to survive the week.
vehicles.notes: The death bike is your raider vehicle. She appears in swarms, the riders screaming, and they attack with melee weapons at speed. Use them to create chaos during convoy encounters — bikes weaving between vehicles, riders leaping onto moving trucks. They're theatrical and expendable.

vehicles.name: Spike Truck
vehicles.desc: A pickup truck with welded spikes, a ram bar, and a mounted weapon in the bed. She's the medium vehicle of the wasteland — tougher than a buggy, faster than a bus, and common enough that every warband has half a dozen. She does everything adequately.
vehicles.notes: The spike truck is your standard wasteland vehicle. She's the default for any encounter — raiders drive them, settlers drive them, the players probably drive one. Her versatility makes her the AK-47 of the wasteland: reliable, ubiquitous, and always dangerous.

vehicles.name: Sand Yacht
vehicles.desc: A wind-powered vehicle on skids or wheels, using a sail to cross the flat desert wastes without burning a drop of fuel. She's slow, she's dependent on wind, and she's the only option for communities that can't afford or find petrol.
vehicles.notes: The sand yacht is your fuel-free alternative. She represents communities too poor for engines but too resourceful to walk. Use her for desert crossings, trade caravans in fuel-scarce regions, and the desperate chase where the players' engine dies and the sand yacht is all that's left.

vehicles.name: Convoy Fortress
vehicles.desc: Not one vehicle but several welded together — a bus, two trucks, and a crane arm forming a mobile compound that opens into a defensible camp. She carries an entire community on her back: workshops, water recycling, sleeping quarters, and the guns to defend all of it.
vehicles.notes: The convoy fortress is your mobile settlement. She's home, she's fortress, and she's the campaign base for a nomadic wasteland community. She can't run — she barely moves — but she's nearly impossible to crack. Use her as the players' home that they must protect, maintain, and keep moving toward whatever promised land lies ahead.
